title: Open a NEC binary in Ghidra
content:
I have a binary dump from a 76F0219F1 NEC processor. I tried to open it in Ghidra, but I don't see any NEC in the list of supported processors.
Does Ghidra support NEC processors? Is there anything I can do to open the NEC binary dump in Ghidra?

comments.text: Probably unsupported but what CPU core is that? 78K, V850, something else?
@Igor, its an automotive MCU on V850 core. Unfortunately, such processors not documented well...

answers_data.content: Yes. If Ghidra does not currently support 76F0219F1 NEC processor architecture, Ghidra can be extended using SLEIGH. Here are some examples of how to do this:

comments.text: I wasn't aware of that, thanks for this

answers_data.content:
No, unfortunately not. Look at this question, among the frequently asked questions.

According to that:

are currently supported.

I'm uploaded some scratches to https://github.com/esaulenka/ghidra_v850

Currently it not usable, but any help are welcome!
